Fresh Install
* Create repository (Voltaweb-checklist git.mb)
* Check if project exists in Filemaker (Or create new website under that client)
* Create Mamp host (venues-online.loc)
* Pull repository, create Develop branch locally  (track) and push
* Add volta-theme and customise
* Remove all files that are generated by gulp
* (ncu to check if up-to-date) remove node_modules folder and run 'ncu -uâ€™
* Run npm install and bower install in theme folder
* Change gulpfile proxy (in gulp.js change url)
* If "gulp Cannot find where you keep your Bower packages." bower install jquery --save

* EACCES: permission denied, open '/Users/Wout/.config/configstore/update-notifier-bower.json'
* You don't have access to this file.
sudo chown -R $USER:$GROUP ~/.npm
sudo chown -R $USER:$GROUP ~/.config

Transfer Https
* Find/Replace Database urls, without http:// and then http:// -> https://
* Generate and Install certificates on mamp and local
* Go to desktop in terminal and apply (copy) script in terminal (check snippets/ssl-install-command.txt)
* Change htaccess (check snippets/.htaccess-snippet)
* Check for mixed content
* Wpml save settings (to reset like permalinks)


Pull
* ssh git@git.volta.be
* git@git.volta.be:PROJECTNAME.git
* Create host .loc , make DB and import
* Make RSS key:
SSH RSS Key:
GO TO DESKTOP FOLDER
Run this command in terminal to allow https on localhost in Chrome and Safari
(change muller to correct name)
openssl req \
-newkey rsa:2048 \
-x509 \
-nodes \
-keyout muller.key \
-new \
-out muller.crt \
-subj /CN=muller.loc \
-reqexts SAN \
-extensions SAN \
-config <(cat /System/Library/OpenSSL/openssl.cnf \
<(printf '[SAN]\nsubjectAltName=DNS:muller.loc')) \
-sha256 \
-days 3650
* Rename generated certificates
* Install certificate: double click and trust
* Go to dev folder
* npm install and gulp
* string replace + http:// -> //
